Provide More Reliable Keyboard Navigation for Guest Buyer Checkout Other Fixes in B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’20 (Version 4.12) Patch Notes for B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’20 (Version 4.12) B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’19 (Version 4.11) Release Notes B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’19 (Version 4.10) Release Notes B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’18 (Version 4.9) Release Notes Upgrade B2B Commerce for Visualforce to a New Release or Patch Resolve Guest User Security Alerts to Keep Your Storefronts Secure... Maintain Established CloudCraze Solutions You are here: SALESFORCE HELP DOCS VISUALFORCE B2B COMMERCE RELEASE NOTES AND UPGRADE GUIDE Maintain JavaScript Libraries That Affect the Storefront Buyer Experience Have confidence that your buyers' browsing experience is smooth and safe across all pages and components on your storefront. This release updates several of the third-party JavaScript libraries that B2B Commerce for Visualforce references by default when rendering front-end behavior. Where: This change applies to B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’20 (version 4.12) in Lightning Experience and Salesforce Classic in Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions. Why: The updated libraries include: LIBRARY VERSION WHAT'S CHANGED? handlebars.js 4.7.2 Change log jquery.js 3.4.1 Change log jquery-migrate.js 3.1.0 Change log jquery.validate.js 1.19.1 Change log nouislider.js 14.1.1 Replaces the unversioned jquery.nouislider.js library. Change log underscore.js 1.9.2 Change log How: After you upgrade the managed package, the ccrz.cc_hk_UserInterface:v004 extension class references these updated libraries by default. To start using the updated libraries on your storefront, build and activate a new configuration cache. If you haven't extended this class with subscriber code, this update doesn't break any existing functionality on your pages. If you have previously extended the default ccrz.cc_hk_UserInterface class, update your subscriber code so that it references the latest versions of these libraries. If you reference these libraries from other locations in your code, update those references, as well. Also, if you previously extended either of the following default Visualforce components, there are some important manual updates: cc_ProductListFilter.component for the Product List page version 2.0 cc_FeatureFilter.component for the Product List page version 1.0 These components called functions from the unversioned jquery.nouislider.js library. Complete the following updates: Update your extensions so that they reference the nouislider.js version 14.1.1 library instead of the unversioned library. Carefully review the nouislider.js library's full revision history for other compatibility with your component extensions. For example, the unversioned library had dependencies on other libraries, but version 14.1.1 no longer has these dependencies. Update the HTML code that renders the slider filter type to include a new id="slider_{{this.sfid}}" attribute. This attribute helps preserve slider filter functionality after you upgrade. For example, previous versions of this component used the following

tag for rendering the slider filter type:

Now, the HTML code uses a
tag with the same attributes, plus the added id attribute:
NOTE Also, nouislider.js version 14.1.1 introduces a difference in the slider filter type's user experience in the Feature Filtering widget. Now, when the minimum and maximum spec values selected in the slider are the same number, the handles for adjusting the range are no longer available. SEE ALSO Build, Activate, or Deactivate a Configuration Cache Default JavaScript Libraries for Storefront Pages Define Product Specs and Create Product List Page Filters Show the Feature Filtering Widget DID THIS ARTICLE SOLVE YOUR ISSUE? Let us know so we can improve! Yes No
title: Maintaining JavaScript Libraries in B2B Commerce
